quiz_questions.q: What is the most common Mystery School type in the world today?
quiz_questions.a: Fire Temples (Zoroastrian dedicated to Mithra, Hindu dedicated to Agni)
quiz_questions.explanation: Still practiced globally, multiple religious traditions

quiz_questions.a: The 365 Æons or Spirits of the Days - one for each day of the year

quiz_questions.q: What is the difference between Isopsephy and Gematria?
quiz_questions.a: Isopsephy (Greek) adds letter values; Gematria (Hebrew) considers same-value words equivalent
quiz_questions.explanation: Gematria goes further - Hebrew 'alive' = 18, so all 18-value words are 'lucky'

quiz_questions.q: What are the 5 aspects of the Egyptian Soul?
quiz_questions.a: Sheut (Shadow), Ren (Name), Ka (Vital essence), Ib (Heart), Ba (Personality), Akh (Mind)
quiz_questions.explanation: Much more complex than Christian concept of soul

quiz_questions.q: Why were Gods depicted with horns in Egypt?
quiz_questions.a: The word 'Ba' meant both 'Soul' and 'Ram' - horns showed the soul aspect
quiz_questions.explanation: Also why Ram sacrifice atoned for sins in ancient religions

quiz_questions.a: 70 Jewish scholars writing oral tradition - became Torah/Bible foundation
quiz_questions.explanation: Commissioned by Ptolemy, all wrote the same thing = 'Words of God'
